newsitem.title: LUXEMBOURG: Court rejects bid for damages by gas bottler ITAMSIDER.
newsitem.headline: Court rejects bid for damages by gas bottler ITAMSIDER.

text.p: The European Court of First Instance rejected on Wednesday a bid for money damages by ITAMSIDER, a manufacturer of gas-bottles, against the European Commission.
ITAMSIDER alleged it suffered losses after bidding for a project under the Regional Gas Programme, financed by the European Development Fund.
The court said it lacked competence to decide responsibility under the terms of the contract and limited its jurisdiction to issues of non-contractual liability on the part of the Commission.
In order to claim damages successfully, the court said ITAMSIDER must show the Commission acted illegally and that the aciton directly caused the damages alleged.
The court rejected ITAMSIDER's claim, and said the Commission took no action which could support an award for damages.

According to the facts in the judgment, ITAMSIDER shipped 40,000 empty gas bottles to the Mauritania Gas Society. After a dispute over quality, the Commission appointed an expert to review the bottles. The expert reported that the bottles did not meet all the required technical specifications.

ITAMSIDER claimed Mauritania Gas was using the bottles, despite non-payment, and despite allegations that the bottles were not up to specifications. ITAMSIDER, forced into bankruptcy, sought indemnification by the European Commission for its losses.
